instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting problem
threads.message: Got another mess board, tryed dfu restore, it restores succefully and i can see ssd at target disk, but when i try boot, it shows apple logo and half loading it goes fan max and restart. tryed 2 different working case for faulty parts but everything seems ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting problem
threads.message:
Check for errors starting in diagnostic mode.
Also test in safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting problem
threads.message: diagnostic mode shows 0 errors everything ok, ill try safe

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> booting problem
threads.message:
So it crashes when tries to load drivers.
Can be GPU issue, or another device.
Test disconnecting touchbar and touch ID.
Also try with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD.
